text: Differential autoregulation of <extra_id_0> glucocorticoid receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression in human T - and B-cell lines .

text: Regulation of <extra_id_0> glucocorticoid receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> GR <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) expression by its cognate ligand was examined in the glucocorticoid - sensitive human leukemic T-cell line 6TG1.1 and in the human B-cell line IM-9 .

text: In contrast to the decrease in <extra_id_0> GR <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA seen in IM-9 cells after treatment with 1 microM dexamethasone for 16-18 h , treatment of 6TG1.1 cells resulted in an 8-fold increase in <extra_id_0> GR <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA , as determined by Northern blot and RNase protection analysis , with a corresponding 3 - to 4-fold increase in <extra_id_0> GR <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein .

text: Half - maximal induction of <extra_id_0> GR <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA and protein in 6TG1.1 cells was observed between 10-100 nM dexamethasone , and inclusion of 1 microM RU 38486 completely blocked the effects of 100 nM dexamethasone , demonstrating that positive autoregulation of <extra_id_0> GR <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression in 6TG1.1 cells is a receptor - mediated response .

text: Positive autoregulation of <extra_id_0> GR <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression was also observed in glucocorticoid - resistant CEM-C1 cells , which contain functional <extra_id_0> GR <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , but whose growth is unaffected by glucocorticoids .
event: <extra_id_0> <extra_id_0> Regulation Positive autoregulation <extra_id_0> Theme expression <extra_id_1> <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Gene_expression expression <extra_id_0> Theme GR <extra_id_1> <extra_id_1> <extra_id_1>

text: Thus , positive autoregulation is neither a consequence nor the sole cause of growth arrest .
The degree of negative autoregulation in IM-9 cells and positive autoregulation in 6TG1.1 cells was unaffected by inhibition of protein synthesis with cycloheximide .
event: <extra_id_0> <extra_id_0> Negative_regulation negative autoregulation <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Positive_regulation positive autoregulation <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Regulation unaffected <extra_id_1> <extra_id_1>

text: Measurement of <extra_id_0> GR <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA turnover in 6TG1.1 cells treated with actinomycin-D revealed a half-life of 2.5 h , which was unaffected by dexamethasone treatment .
A similar half-life was determined in IM-9 cells and was also unaffected by steroid treatment .

These results are consistent with the interpretation that glucocorticoid - mediated autoregulation of <extra_id_0> GR <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression is a tissue - specific primary transcriptional response .
